This is a rich and deep book, so we will continue discussing it at the May meeting.

 

Tibetan Book of Living and Dying

Sogyal Rinpoche, Patrick Gaffney & Andrew Harvey, editors

20th Anniversary edition, 2002 (first published 1992)

Foreword by the His Holiness the Dalai Lama

Please pick a section, paragraph or sentence that you find compelling and would like to discuss.

Overview

This acclaimed spiritual masterpiece is widely regarded as one of the most complete and authoritative presentations of the Tibetan Buddhist teachings ever written. A manual for life and death and a magnificent source of sacred inspiration from the heart of the Tibetan tradition, The Tibetan Book Of Living and Dying provides a lucid and inspiring introduction to the practice of meditation, to the nature of mind, to karma and rebirth, to compassionate love and care for the dying, and to the trials and rewards of the spiritual path.

This book is available free on PDF:  http://www.holybooks.com/wp-content/uploads/The-Tibetan-Book-of-Living-and-Dying.pdf
